title: Short-Term Course on Cognitive Load Theory-Based Mathematical Problem-Solving Strategies for K-12

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary-level mathematical fundamentals and smart device utilization skills
context.additional_context: Modular 5-10 minute learning accessible via smartphones, applying project-based assessment to real-life problem-solving

learning_goals: Explain three strategies for decomposing complex mathematical problems step-by-step within working memory capacity
Apply cognitive load management principles to enable over 70% of learners to solve complex equation problems at least 50% faster
Systematically document problem-solving processes using visual aids (diagrams/infographics) provided in mobile environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
